alert.note: Alert for Dauphin; Lebanon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 2:10AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Dauphin and Lebanon. * WHEN...Until 415 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 208 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall of 0.5 to 1 inches is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lebanon, Hershey, Middletown, Palmyra, Annville, Hummelstown, Cornwall, Myerstown, Rutherford, Campbelltown, Pleasant Hill, Sand Hill, Newmanstown, Lebanon South, Cleona, Avon, Richland, Quentin, Jonestown and Avon Heights. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
